title: Capacitors - Q with 2V applied to 5cm x 5cm plates

content.question: A parallel-plate capacitor is made from two square plates, each of side length <math alttext="5.0 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math>, separated by a distance of <math alttext="0.10 millimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>mm</mi></math>. When a potential difference of <math alttext="2.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math> is applied between the plates, what is the magnitude of the charge stored on each plate?

choices.label: <math alttext="2.2 times 10 raised to the negative 10 power coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

<math alttext="4.4 times 10 raised to the negative 10 power coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
<math alttext="25 coulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
<math alttext="50 coulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4.4 times 10 raised to the negative 10 power coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
